title: White Sox win draft lottery, will pick 1st in 2026
content: The White Sox, who had the best odds to win the 2026 MLB draft lottery, will pick first in next summer's draft, followed by the Rays at No. 2 and the Twins at No. 3.

title: Sources: Tigers give Finnegan 2-year, $19M pact
content: Kyle Finnegan, 34, and the Tigers are in agreement on a two-year, $19 million contract, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan on Tuesday, confirming a report. Detroit keeps a key bullpen piece as it seeks a third straight playoff appearance.

title: Slot wonders if Salah thinks he 'made a mistake'
content: Liverpool coach Arne Slot questioned whether Mohamed Salah should be the one to initiate a conversation with him following his explosive interview at the weekend.

title: Big 12 commish: Irish AD's behavior 'egregious'
content: Big 12 commissioner Brett Yormark took issue Tuesday with Notre Dame athletic director Pete Bevacqua's criticism this week of the ACC, calling his behavior "egregious."

title: Dybantsa, Wright fuel huge BYU rally vs. Clemson
content: Behind the largest second-half comeback in program history, one fueled by AJ Dybantsa and capped by Robert Wright III, BYU took down Clemson, 67-64, in the Jimmy V Classic on Tuesday night.

title: Knicks, closer to an identity, reach NBA Cup semis
content: The Knicks advanced to the NBA Cup semifinals in Las Vegas with a convincing 117-101 victory over the Raptors on Tuesday night, their eighth victory in nine games.

title: Paul 'at peace with everything' after Clips ouster
content: Chris Paul said he's "at peace with everything" and is excited for what's next following his stunning ouster from the LA Clippers earlier this month.

title: Minority owners target Ishbia's stake in filing
content: A filing in a lawsuit against Mat Ishbia includes new financial details that two Suns minority owners say could threaten Ishbia's majority ownership.

title: ðŸ‘€ What Shams is hearing on NBA trade season
content: As NBA trade season nears, the futures of Anthony Davis and Giannis Antetokounmpo are in focus. Here's everything we're hearing.

title: Highlights, top moments as Knicks, Magic punch tickets to Vegas
content: Here are the top moments and highlights from the NBA Cup quarterfinals as the Orlando Magic and New York Knicks advanced to Las Vegas.

title: Predicting the top 5 picks in the 2026 MLB draft after White Sox win lottery
content: With Chicago landing the No. 1 overall pick for next summer, let's see how the start of the first round could go down.

title: Jimmy V Men's Classic guide: Breaking down BYU, UConn wins
content: BYU and UConn pulled off close victories against Clemson and Florida in the 2025 Jimmy V Men's Classic.

title: Men's Bracketology: Iowa State replaces Purdue as a 1-seed
content: In knocking off former 1-seed Purdue, unbeaten Iowa State changed its trajectory and is now on the top line.

title: Solak's second look at Week 14: We're fixing the Chiefs' biggest issues and sorting AFC South chaos
content: Ben Solak lays out ways to improve the Chiefs' struggling offense, makes his case for the Jaguars' legitimacy and more.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus most shocking statistics of this season
content: We unveil our latest rankings and also look at the most surprising statistical rankings for each team.

title: Peralta to Red Sox? Greene to Dodgers? Best fits for top potential pitching trade candidates
content: A number of teams have the need -- and means -- to trade for a starting pitcher this winter. Here's how they match up with available hurlers.

title: MLB winter meetings updates, rumors: What will follow huge deals for Diaz, Schwarber?
content: Here's everything you need from Orlando as big signings by the Dodgers and Phillies rock the winter meetings.

title: Not a 'layup': USA clash could be the most hyped in Socceroos history
content: Australia's game against the United States won't be the biggest World Cup match that the Socceroos have ever played -- but it might be the most hyped.

title: Vindication? Liverpool earns Slot much-needed win amid Salah saga
content: In a week dominated by the fallout created by Mo Salah's comments, Arne Slot and Liverpool showed plenty of resolve in beating Inter 1-0 in the Champions League.

title: How the 2026 World Cup killed the 'group of death'
content: Everyone wants to know: which teams are in the group of death for the 2026 World Cup? Well, the "group of death" may be officially dead.

title: Wolfsburg's wastefulness opens door for Madrid to join UWCL contenders
content: Former powerhouse Wolfsburg's campaign is unraveling, while Real Madrid look poised to finish top-four in the UWCL table.

title: Rankings for Week 15
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Flex and superflex rankings for Week 15
content: Trying to decide between a couple of closely ranked players this week? Eric Karabell is here to help.

title: Which NHL player and team trends are for real? The trend-o-meter for all 32
content: From Morgan Geekie's scoring rate to the "Wall of St. Paul" and more, here's what will and won't continue.

title: The NHL's best this week: Terry Ryan and hockey dreams
content: From first-round draft pick to iconic character, Ryan's path is a unique one. Plus, this week's key NHL games.

title: Do college sports need a CBA? Some ADs are starting to think soï»¿
content: A growing number of athletic directors say they are interested in exploring a once-unthinkable option.

title: How each of the 12 College Football Playoff teams could win the national title
content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: Jameis Winston trolls Florida State football, praises women's soccer champs
content: The former Seminoles quarterback was excited about the Florida State's women's soccer team's fifth title ... and less than impressed by his old squad.

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: Does Bron Breakker really want the 'old CM Punk'?
content: Bron Breakker's callout of CM Punk and Gunther's vow to make John Cena give up highlight Monday night's "Raw."

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Schlotterbeck, Singo
content: Liverpool are reportedly looking to improve their defense. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Week 14 only added more chaos to the NFL playoff race -- "a bookmaker's dream"
content: Week 14 "set the tone" for many NFL teams as Super Bowl favorites faltered and underdogs picked up steam.

title: Early Week 15 bets: Patriots over Bills, Lions to cover in shootout with Rams
content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five games we're eyeing for bets going into Week 15.

title: Pickups: Ryan Nembhard, Quentin Grimes among players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Foster cruises past Fulton, moves up at junior lightweight
content: O'Shaquie Foster was dominant against Stephen Fulton, earning higher ranking. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Lando Norris isn't an F1 'badass.' His vulnerability makes him a unique champion
content: In a sport where athletes are expected to be "badass," newly crowned F1 champion Lando Norris' openness to talking about his emotions is a rarity.

title: â€˜Model neighboursâ€™ to 'fugitives' overnight: Upscale Delhi colony in shock
content: The family home of Goa nightclub owners Gaurav and Saurabh Luthra, implicated in a fatal fire, stands deserted in Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar. Neighbours recall the family as religious and good-natured, expressing shock at their alleged flight to Phuket. The brothers' business journey from local boutiques to successful cafes is also detailed.

title: 'How can tickets cost Rs 35-39k?' HC pulls up govt over IndiGo chaos
content: The Delhi high court questioned the Centre's failure to prevent IndiGo's flight cancellations and soaring airfares, demanding to know immediate measures taken for stranded passengers. The court also sought explanations on arrangements made to manage travellers and prevent harassment, as hundreds of flights were scrapped, leaving lakhs stranded nationwide.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Luthra brothers still in Thailand â€” can they be extradited?
content: Goa police are pursuing nightclub owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, who fled to Thailand after a fire killed 25. Interpol has issued a Blue Corner Notice, and India's extradition treaty with Thailand is now central to bringing the brothers to justice. The treaty obligates both nations to surrender individuals wanted for serious offenses.

title: ICC Rankings: Virat Kohli vs Rohit Sharma - Battle for No.1 ODI batter heats up
content: Star India batter Virat Kohli is closing in on the No.1 ODI batter ranking, now second behind Rohit Sharma after a stellar series against South Africa.  Other Indian cricketers like KL Rahul and Kuldeep Yadav also saw significant climbs in the ICC rankings across formats, highlighting India's strong presence in international cricket.

title: More trouble for IndiGo? After 5,000 flight cancellations, CCI may launch probe
content: IndiGo faces potential competition law investigation following thousands of flight cancellations due to crew shortages. India's competition watchdog is considering probing the airline for misusing its dominant market position.

title: Google may shock Nvidia again; may double TPU production by 2028
content: Google is reportedly challenging Nvidia's AI chip dominance with its Tensor Processing Units (TPUs).  Analysts predict a significant increase in TPU production and external sales, potentially generating billions in revenue.  This development has unsettled Nvidia investors as Google's TPUs power advanced AI models and are being offered to external clients.

title: 'Will not accept': Tharoor declines 'Veer Savarkar Award'; here's what he said
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor declined the Veer Savarkar Award, calling organizers irresponsible for announcing his name without consent. He learned of the award through media reports and stated he neither knew about nor accepted it. HRDS India, however, claims they notified Tharoor and visited him to extend the invitation.

title: IND vs SA: 'I don't sugarcoat things in my life' - Hardik's blunt take after match-winning return
content: Hardik Pandya attributes his strong comeback from injury to a positive mindset, enabling him to return "stronger, bigger and better." His impressive performance in the T20I against South Africa, featuring an unbeaten 59 and a wicket, showcased his full recovery. Pandya emphasized relying on inner confidence and enjoying the game, drawing energy from the crowd as a key motivator.

title: SpiceJet expands with 100 more flights daily! Stock jumps 5%
content: SpiceJet is significantly boosting its winter operations, adding up to 100 daily flights to meet surging demand amid IndiGo's widespread cancellations. This expansion, supported by reactivated aircraft, aims to capitalize on market gaps. IndiGo's pilot shortage led to over 5,000 flight cancellations and a government-mandated schedule reduction, creating an opportunity for competitors and potentially rebalancing market share.

title: Google launches AI Plus in India; What users get for Rs 199 per month
content: Google has launched its AI Plus subscription in India. Priced at Rs 399 monthly, it offers advanced AI features. New users can get it for Rs 199 for six months. This plan provides access to Gemini 3 Pro, enhanced image and video creation tools, and more cloud storage. It aims to cater to India's growing AI engagement.

title: Sudha Murty calls for teaching Vande Mataram in schools: How it benefits students
content: Rajya Sabha MP Sudha Murty urged making Vande Mataram compulsory in schools, highlighting its role in instilling courage, sacrifice, and a sense of belonging among students. Marking the songâ€™s 150th anniversary, she emphasized its historical significance during Indiaâ€™s freedom struggle and noted that teaching national songs fosters values, civic consciousness, memory retention, and a lasting connection to the countryâ€™s cultural and moral heritage.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection day 6: Spy actioner crosses Rs 150 crore
content: Aditya Dhar's directorial 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has become a box office sensation, garnering positive reviews and impressive collections. The film demonstrated strong weekday stability, maintaining collections in the Rs. 20 crore range and is now eyeing Rs 200 crore by the end of its first week, with potential to enter the Rs 500 crore club.

title: Exclusive | 'It's loyalty': Rovman Powell on why Caribbean stars stick to their IPL franchises
content: Rovman Powell reflects on how franchise leagues transformed his life -- from financial security to building lifelong friendships. The West Indies power-hitter opens up about his journey from Bannister, discovering his talent early, and the discipline that shaped his career. Powell discusses natural Caribbean power, ILT20â€™s impact on UAE cricket, the Caribbean loyalty seen in IPL stars, and why six sixes in an over will soon be more common.

title: Tech layoffs: Maha labour minister responds in council; his written reply on TCS layoffs
content: Maharashtra Labour Minister Aakash Fundkar confirmed 376 TCS employees were laid off at Pune campuses in the last two quarters. The minister clarified these job cuts were not linked to AI or automation, primarily impacting middle and senior-level managers. The government is monitoring the IT sector's employment situation.

title: Diwali makes it to Unesco list; joins Yoga, Durga Puja among intangible cultural heritage
content: Deepavali has been inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Cultural Heritage list, marking the 16th Indian tradition to receive this honor. This recognition occurred during the 20th session of the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage, hosted by India in New Delhi. The committee is reviewing 67 nominations from 79 countries.

title: 'Present comprehensive data': DGCA summons IndiGo CEO on Thursday; orders inspection at 11 airports
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has summoned IndiGo's CEO for an emergency meeting. This follows days of mass flight cancellations and passenger complaints. The regulator is conducting on-site assessments at airports. IndiGo leadership must account for its handling of the disruption. The airline has cancelled thousands of flights nationwide.

title: Gave fake name, ID: Watch how cops arrested Luigi Mangione for CEO murder
content: Newly released bodycam footage captures the moment murder suspect Luigi Mangione was apprehended at a Pennsylvania McDonald's, a year after his initial arrest. Alerted by customers recognizing his distinctive eyebrows, police confronted Mangione, who initially provided a false name.

title: Marvin Harrison Jr. injury update: Heel issue puts Cardinals WRâ€™s week 15 return in doubt
content: Marvin Harrison Jr.'s rookie season faces another hurdle with a heel issue, sidelining him for Week 14 and making his Week 15 availability uncertain.  With the Cardinals out of playoff contention, they are unlikely to rush him back. Michael Wilson has stepped up significantly in Harrison's absence, capitalizing on increased opportunities and becoming a key offensive contributor.

title: 20 stitches! Cricket coach assaulted with bat over team selection; FIR lodged
content: Pondicherry U-19 coach S Venkataraman was severely assaulted by three local cricketers at the CAP training facility after being dropped from the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy squad. The attack, which left Venkataraman with a head injury and shoulder fracture, has led to an FIR and an ongoing police investigation against the assailants.

title: CBSE issues new rules for class 10 science, social science boards: What students must follow
content: CBSE has introduced new rules for Class 10 Science and Social Science exams. Students must now write answers only in their designated sections. Examiners will not award marks for answers placed in the wrong section, even if correct. Schools are urged to practice this format. This change aims to prevent confusion and mark loss during evaluations.

title: 107 oppn MPs submit notice to remove Madras HC judge over lamp-lighting order
content: Over 100 opposition MPs have submitted a notice to the Lok Sabha Speaker seeking the removal of Madras High Court Justice GR Swaminathan. They accuse him of misconduct and bias in a recent order concerning a lamp lighting at a temple near a dargah in Tamil Nadu.

title: Ex-AIIMS director Randeep Guleria on why vaccination must be priority for ageing adults
content: India's aging population faces increased infection risks due to declining immunity and chronic diseases. Experts urge integrating adult vaccinations like flu, pneumonia, and shingles into routine healthcare. Despite awareness of vaccination's importance, low uptake stems from poor risk perception and lack of structured programs. Proactive measures are crucial for healthy aging.

title: Amazon doubles down on India, announces a massive $35B investment by 2030
content: Amazon has pledged a massive $35 billion investment in India by 2030, building on its existing $40 billion. This significant capital infusion will focus on AI-driven digitization, boosting exports to $80 billion, and creating one million new jobs. The move follows Microsoft's substantial AI investment announcement, signaling a major tech push in the country.

title: Wedding cancelled: Smriti Mandhana's three big updates you can't miss - details inside
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and composer Palash Muchhal have confirmed their wedding is called off. Mandhana returned to training and posted a cryptic message about control. Muchhal expressed anguish over baseless rumors and announced legal action. Both have requested privacy for their families. Mandhana reaffirms her focus on cricket for India's upcoming international season.

title: â€˜Just a partnerâ€™: Goa nightclub co-ownerâ€™s 1st reaction after detention; hunt on for Luthras
content: Goa Police have detained Ajay Gupta, a co-owner of the Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub, following a deadly fire that claimed 25 lives.  Primary owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra fled to Phuket and are being sought via Interpol.  Authorities are also pursuing a British national connected to the property.  Several other club employees have been arrested as investigations intensify.

title: India captain: 'We always knew' - Ex-BCCI selector reveals Gill was earmarked since 2023
content: Shubman Gill's recent appointment as T20I vice-captain signals a clear path towards him becoming India's sole captain across all formats. Former selector Salil Ankola revealed Gill's leadership potential was recognised as early as 2023, with consensus among selectors and senior players. Gill's exceptional batting and Test captaincy in England solidified confidence in his readiness to lead.

title: West Bengal: Two assaulted for selling chicken puffs to Gita recital attendees; row erupts
content: Two chicken puff vendors in Kolkata's Esplanade area were assaulted and their food thrown away by a group allegedly for selling non-vegetarian items during a mass Gita recital. The victims filed FIRs, with one incident captured in a viral video. Police are investigating, while political parties exchanged accusations.

title: Chicken momos fed to cows: Gurgaon man thrashed, paraded; viral video triggers fury
content: A 28-year-old man was thrashed and paraded after a video showed him feeding chicken momos to a cow during a live stream. Outraged Bajrang Dal members filed an FIR against him for hurting religious sentiments. He was later granted bail.

title: Bomb scare: 3 Delhi schools receive threat emails; students evacuated
content: Multiple Delhi schools received bomb threat emails on Wednesday, leading to early dispersal of students and police investigations. Parents were instructed to collect children in a phased manner to avoid panic. This follows similar threats to Delhi University colleges last week, with no suspicious objects found.

title: Exclusive | 'One Indian is surprising': Anish Giri rates Candidates 2026 line-up
content: 20-year-old Indian GM R Praggnanandhaa secured his spot in the Candidates 2026, joining his sister R Vaishali. Dutch Grandmaster Anish Giri, however, believes India could have had more representatives than just one. Giri also highlighted the formidable nature of lower-rated players in the line-up like Matthias Bluebaum, predicting a highly competitive tournament.

title: Hâ€‘1B visa interviews deferred to 2026: 5 ways Indian applicants can navigate delay
content: Indian graduates planning U.S. careers face significant H-1B visa interview delays extending into 2026. New U.S. State Department vetting rules are causing these deferments. Applicants are advised to stay calm, explore remote work, upskill, manage finances, and consider alternative career pathways. Proactive preparation can ensure a smooth transition when visas are eventually approved.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Luthra brothers approach Delhi court for anticipatory bail; hearing today
content: Goa nightclub co-owners Gaurav and Saurabh Luthra have sought anticipatory bail in Delhi as investigations into a deadly fire intensify. Interpol has issued a blue corner notice against the brothers, believed to be in Thailand, while their business partner was detained. Authorities are also moving to impound their passports.

title: IND vs SA: 'Gill is now in the Kohliâ€“Rohit league': SA great on why Samson is not in playing XI
content: Sanju Samson's T20I future appears uncertain as Shubman Gill's elevated status pushes him out of the playing XI. Experts suggest Gill is now in the league of Rohit and Kohli, making it difficult to displace him from the opening slot. This leaves Samson, a successful opener, relegated to a finisher role, which many believe doesn't suit him.

title: Pakistan star batter mocked: 'Bumrah ko chhakka maarna itna aasaan nahi hota' - Watch
content: India dominated South Africa in the first T20I, winning by 101 runs thanks to Hardik Pandya's explosive 59*. The bowlers, led by Arshdeep Singh and Jasprit Bumrah, restricted the visitors to 74. Meanwhile, commentator Aakash Chopra's witty remark about hitting Bumrah for a six went viral, playfully referencing Pakistan's Sahibzada Farhan.

title: Gabrielle Union says Dwyane Wadeâ€™s mom and sister initially had 'issues' with her
content: Gabrielle Union revealed Dwyane Wade's family, particularly his sister, initially questioned her intentions due to their age difference and her childless status. The couple also navigated the fallout from Wade fathering a child with another woman during a 2013 separation. Despite these challenges, their love prevailed, leading to their 2014 marriage.

title: Meesho makes strong debut! Stock lists at 46% premium; check price, outlook & more
content: E-commerce platform Meesho debuted on Dalal Street after a Rs 5,421.20 crore IPO, which saw an overall subscription of 79 times. The company reported strong revenue growth and narrowing EBITDA losses in FY25, with significant user expansion outside major cities. Despite positive operational metrics, risks related to cash-on-delivery and competition persist.

title: Zelenskyy's army is losing war, he should compromise: Trump
content: US President Donald Trump declared Europe "decaying" and "weak," suggesting the US should no longer guarantee its security. He urged Ukraine's President Zelensky to "get on the ball" and accept compromise in ceasefire talks, stating Ukraine is losing the war. Trump also called for elections in Ukraine, accusing its leadership of using the conflict to avoid them.

title: Why has US revoked 85,000 visas of all categories?
content: The Trump administration has revoked 85,000 visas this year, a significant increase from last year, citing reasons like DUIs and assaults. This move is part of a broader crackdown on immigration, impacting various visa categories. Some visas were also revoked on account of celebration for Charlie Kirk's murder.

title: Man experiences serious stroke after consuming several energy drinks at work
content: A seemingly healthy 54-year-old man suffered a severe stroke due to consuming eight energy drinks daily, leading to dangerously high blood pressure. Doctors were baffled until he revealed his extreme caffeine intake. While quitting the drinks improved his condition, the stroke left him with permanent nerve damage, highlighting hypertension's silent danger.

title: IND vs SA: 'It's not about what Hardik wants, it's about India': 'Gutsy' Pandya sparks crushing win
content: Hardik Pandya's explosive unbeaten 59 off 28 balls powered India to a dominant 101-run victory in the first T20I against South Africa.  Pandya's calculated counterattack, fueled by intense fitness work and a team-first approach, set a challenging target.  A potent bowling attack then dismantled the visitors, securing a commanding win.

title: Petr Yan climbs back to top at flyweight and isn't the only new No. 1
content: the latest ESPN divisional rankings feature many changes . there were seven ranked fighters on Saturday's UFC 323, including all four participants . the headline fight, in which Petr Yan dethroned Merab Dvalishvili, had a definitive result .

title: Previewing the NBA Cup quarterfinals
content: the 2025 Emirates NBA Cup quarterfinals kick off on tuesday . leBron James goes off for 29 points to power the lakers to a close win over the 76ers . the team will have to advance without star Franz Wagner, who left the game because of a high ankle sprain .

title: Women's Bracketology: How the Big Ten is shaping the field
content: 16 new teams entered the bracket this week and 26 more moved at least one seed line . the big Ten was the exception for a conference that is consistently putting 13 teams in the field . Michigan State was held to just 64 points in a loss at Wisconsin .

title: 'It's an advantage': How post-ups became the NBA's most efficient play
content: post-ups were once a staple of inside-out offenses across the league . but by 2019, they'd been declining in frequency for years . in a post-game rant, a coach on the Dallas Mavericks explained why .

title: A No. 1 recruit, retention and role players: How BYU built a roster to contend
content: AJ Dybantsa announced his commitment to BYU in 2024 . the Cougars were the first five-star recruits since the ESPN recruiting database started in 2007 . a balanced mix of stars and role players has been a key factor for the team .

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: Netflix faces consumer class action over $72bn Warner Bros deal
content: a consumer lawsuit seeks to block a $72 billion acquisition of Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming businesses . some members of Congress have sharply questioned Netflix's proposal . the lawsuit said the deal would eliminate one of Netflix''s closest rivals, HBO Max .

title: Canada unveils new 'Express Entry' category for doctors
content: a new Express Entry category will be created for foreign doctors with at least one year of recent Canadian work experience . invitations under the new stream will begin in early 2026 . the govt will also reserve 5,000 federal admission spaces for provinces and territories to nominate licensed physicians with job offers .

title: â€˜Why can't we have people from Norway, Sweden?â€™ Trump goes on rant against immigrants â€“ watch
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: 'Power of money': MP couple's 'dream' wedding becomes ground for trolls
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: US visa chaos: Many H-1B interviews cancelled as social media review rule set to kick in
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. Read More

title: PM Modi, Amit Shah, Rahul Gandhi Meet To Pick Chief Information Commissioner
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah, and the Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi are holding a closed-door meeting to decide the next Chief Information Commissioner.

title: Sindh Leader's "Extremist-Controlled Nukes" Warning Amid Asim Munir's Rise In Pakistan
content: As Pakistan's powerful Asim Munir faces intense criticism at home and abroad for what many describe as an unconstitutional and unreasonable concentration of authority, a Pakistani politician has issued a dramatic public appeal to PM Narendra Modi.

title: "Filthy, Dirty, Disgusting": Trump's Racist Tirade Against African Migrants
content: Unleashing a xenophobic tirade, US President Donald Trump disparaged Somalia as "filthy, dirty, disgusting, ridden with crime", calling immigrants from the African nation "garbage" he does not want in America.

title: "How Were Airlines Allowed To Overcharge?" Court To Centre On IndiGo Crisis
content: The court told the Centre that while it "appreciates their efforts" in handling the chaos, why such a situation had precipitated in the first place.

title: 2 Friends Mine 15.34-Carat Diamond Worth Rs 50 Lakh In Madhya Pradesh
content: Satish Khatik and Sajid Mohammad leased a mine recently in the diamond-rich soil of Madhya Pradesh's Panna, hoping to overcome their financial crisis and arrange funds for their sisters' weddings.

title: M Kharge's "Chanakya" Quip For Colleague, BJP's 'Internal Fight' Claim
content: The fiery speech of Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge during the discussion on the 150 years of Vande Mataram was punctuated by some light moments when the veteran leader responded to a prompt by party colleague Jairam Ramesh

title: Pune Land Scam Main Accused Sued Actor Ranbir Kapoor In 2018, Claims Activist
content: Shital Tejwani had claimed that Ranbir Kapoor evicted his tenants from his flat in Trump Tower in Pune without any prior notice.

title: Next Japan Megaquake Could Trigger 98-Foot Tsunami Waves, Kill 2 Lakh People
content: Japan issued a megaquake advisory on Tuesday, a day after an earthquake of magnitude 7.5 struck off the country's eastern coast of Aomori, the northernmost prefecture of the island of Honshu, and just south of the island of Hokkaido.

title: YouTube Leads UK Online Viewing With 51 Minutes Daily: Report
content: Britons watched YouTube on average for 51 minutes a day in 2025 on smartphones, tablets and PCs, regulator Ofcom said, noting that services from its owner Alphabet and from Meta account for more than half of all time spent online.

title: See Pics: Glittering Exhibition Of Royal Jewels In Paris After Louvre Heist
content: A glittering exhibition of royal jewels is opening Wednesday in Paris even as the city still reels from the brazen crown-jewel heist at the nearby Louvre Museum.

title: Japan Scrambles Jets Amid Russian-Chinese Joint Patrols Near Territory
content: Japan has scrambled jets to monitor Russian and Chinese air forces conducting joint patrols around the country, the Japanese defence ministry said late Tuesday, amid rising tensions between Tokyo and Beijing.

title: Maria Corina Machado's Daughter To Accept Nobel Peace Prize: Institute
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, who is in hiding, will be represented by her daughter at Wednesday's awarding of the Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo, organisers said.

title: Shashi Tharoor Declines 'Veer Savarkar Award' With A Jibe At Organisers
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has been nominated for an award named after Veer Savarkar, in what risked turning into another flashpoint between the Thiruvananthapuram MP and his party.

title: Can Goa Club Owners Be Extradited From Thailand? What Treaty Says
content: Before India can put the Luthra brothers - Gaurav and Saurabh, owners of the Goa nightclub where a devastating fire killed 25 people - on trial for alleged negligence and murder, it has to get them back in the country.

title: Microsoft, Intel, Cognizant: Tech CEOs Meet PM Modi Over India Expansion
content: Tech leaders, including Cognizant's Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Ravi Kumar S, Intel's CEO Lip-Bu Tan, and Microsoft Chairman and CEO Satya Nadella, met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday

title: Parliament Winter Session Live: Lok Sabha Debates Electoral Reforms, Amit Shah To Address At 5 PM
content: Parliament Winter Session Live: Lok Sabha will discuss Election Reforms, while the Rajya Sabha will witness the conclusion of 'Vande Mataram' debate.

title: Ambuja Cements Selected For 1st Indo-Swedish CCU Pilot In Global Cement Sector
content: Ambuja Cements, part of the Adani Portfolio has been selected for the first Indo-Swedish Carbon Capture and Utilisation (CCU) pilot in the global cement sector.

title: Apple To Open 5th India Store In Noida Tomorrow
content: In a boost to India's electronics manufacturing growth story, US tech giant Apple on Wednesday previewed Apple Noida, its first retail store here and fifth in the country so far.

title: "That Beautiful Face, Lips Like Machine Gun": Trump On His Press Secretary
content: US President Donald Trump recently heaped effusive praise on his White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt's "beautiful face" and "lips" during a speech that was meant to tout his economic agenda.

title: "Best Offers Ever": US Official On Trade Talks With India
content: The US is pushing ahead with intensive trade negotiations with India, with US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer telling lawmakers that New Delhi has made "the best we've ever received as a country" in ongoing discussions.

title: 'Donâ€™t want a woman who marries her brother...': Trump slams Ilhan Omar
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Licences of 176 retailers, 39 wholesalers cancelled over substandard medicines: Maharashtra Minister
content: Maharashtraâ€™s Food and Drug Administration Minister said 36 samples were tested at 10 locations across Mumbai, Thane, Pune, Aurangabad and Nagpur divisions, of which 34 were found to be substandard

title: CM Stalin determines target of 440 votes for DMK at his booth
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister and DMK president M.K. Stalin, spearheading the My Boothâ€“Victory Booth movement, stated that the army of black and red shirts will confront the Shahs of Delhi

content: He used to accuse his wife of too much involvement in phone use and neglecting household chores as well as not caring for their children properly

title: Kerala court defers Congress leader Sandeep Varierâ€™s anticipatory bail plea in survivor-defamation case to December 15
content: Prosecution tells court that it requires more time to process and forensically examine â€˜incriminatingâ€™ social media posts attributed by the complainant to Sandeep Varier. However, it is unclear whether the judge stayed Varierâ€™s arrest till the next hearing

title: Karnataka readies legislation to provide menstrual leave, expands scope to include students and transpersons
content: The first such legislation in the country, the Bill not only expands the scope those eligible for leave, but also proposes setting up Karnataka Women Well Being Authority

title: India's new flight duty norms appear more restrictive compared to other jurisdictions: IATA DG
content: The second phase of the Flight Duty Time Limitations (FDTL) norms have restricted the number of night landings a pilot can make, among other aspects

title: Goa CM holds high-level meet ahead of Christmas, New Year celebrations
content: The meeting was held against the backdrop of the December 6 fire tragedy at Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub at Arpora in North Goa in which 25 persons were killed, according to sources

title: Arecanut imported from LDECs in 2024-25 accounted for 1.5% of Indiaâ€™s domestic production, says Union Minister
content: As per government data, the annual average price of arecanut has remained above â‚¹40,000 per quintal during the last four years, and has not shown any significant decline

title: Health Ministry launches awareness campaign in Delhi metro on women's health, well-being
content: The campaign will deliver messages on women's safety, mental health support, digital inclusion, Pre-Conception and Prenatal Diagnostic Techniques (PC-PNDT) and tuberculosis awareness across metro trains and select stations

title: Centre approves road projects worth â‚¹44,771 crore for Odisha
content: The approved projects included widening of the National Highway between Bhubaneswar and Puri, and the 140-km-long Tangi-Puintola-Ichchapuram Road

title: From Colonial Kitchens to Kerala Plantations: The story of Indiaâ€™s first Christmas cake
content: In 19th-century Kerala, families in Pala and Kanjirappally adapted European plum cakes with local spices and rum-soaked fruits. Today, young bakers are reviving heirloom recipes, baked in small batches in borma ovens

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT defers recording Ramesh Chennithalaâ€™s statement
content: SIT was slated to record Chennithalaâ€™s statement at Kerala Police Crime Branch office at 11 a.m. The MLAâ€™s office said SIT contacted them at 10 a.m. and informed that investigating officer was indisposed without citing any reason

title: Deepavali inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Cultural Heritage list
content: India currently has 15 elements inscribed on the UNESCO's Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity

title: Kerala local body polls: As Kochi Corporation awaits new council, experts and residents flag core urban challenges
content: Peopleâ€™s opinions range from outright criticism to cautious optimism, and concerns about the lack of clarity on the direction Kochi city should adopt for future development

content: â€œThe police registered a case, and a search was on for the truck driver. The bodies were sent for post-mortem,â€ the police said

content: According to an official, at leastÂ six acresÂ of land is required for building a full-fledged depot, whileÂ two acresÂ is essential for developing a city bus terminus

content: The Lok Sabha continues its discussion on election reforms; the Rajya Sabha will take up discussion on election reforms on Thursday (December 11, 2025)

title: Over 30% students of secondary level in Odisha not able to make transition to higher level: CAG
content: During 2018-23, 1.50 lakh out of 5.47 lakh children enrolled in classes I to XI, discontinued education before reaching the immediate higher class, the agency finds

title: PMO reviews IndiGo flight disruptions with officials from Ministry of Civil Aviation, DGCAÂ and AAI

title: Arunachal capital region shuts down over demand to oust migrants
content: Three youth organisations have also been protesting against unauthorised religious structures in the State

title: Bihar cabinet approves creation of three new departments
content: The three newly created departments are Youth, Employment & Skill Development, Higher Education, and Civil Aviation; DA hiked for employees, pensioners getting 5th & 6th pay

title: Everyone should register themselves as Hindus in upcoming census, asks VHP president
content: The VHPâ€™s request came in response to demands from various sections of society, like Adivasis, to include a separate religion code for them

title: The mysterious death of Annamalai University student Udayakumar 54 years ago
content: In July 1971, a controversy was triggered by Annamalai University conferring the honorary degree of Doctor of Letters upon then Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi. The sad aspect of the row was the death of K.P. Udayakumar, a third-year student of B.Sc. (Maths), under circumstances that have remained a mystery to date.

title: Torture in Madras 140 years ago: when a manâ€™s moustache was pulled out
content: Two mid-19th century testimonies reveal the brutal torture routinely inflicted by local officials in Madras; the accounts formed part of the Madras Torture Commission report

title: Gemini Ganesan-starrer Avvaiyar brings alive temple at Thirumullaivoyal
content: I could not help reflecting on how much of a valuable record cinema is when it comes to capturing heritage for posterity. And at the same time, it also highlights what we have lost

title: Committee to Protect Journalists writes to PM Modi, urges him to address the matter of jailed journalists
content: Noting that India is a signatory to the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, the non-profit press freedom organisation said it was incumbent upon the government to â€œuphold its international and domestic human rights obligationsâ€.

title: Kejriwal says Gujarat govt stopped him from meeting jailed farmers

title: No deaths due to air pollution, Centre tells Rajya Sabha
content: Health effects of air pollution are a synergistic manifestation of factors which include food habits, occupational habits, socio-economic status, medical history, immunity, heredity, etc. of the individuals, says Minister of State for Health Prataprao Jadhav

title: A deep cleaning of Indiaâ€™s electoral rolls
content: The revision and verification of electoral rolls is a routine and necessary process. Such corrections do not, by themselves, imply disenfranchisement or targeting

title: CM Revanth to visit Osmania University on Dec.10
content: The visit carries symbolic weight, coinciding with the 16th anniversary of the announcement to carve out Telangana as a separate State, on December 9, 2009

title: T.N.â€™s type 1 diabetes registry enrols over 5,000 children, specialised care centres being expanded
content: Launched in August 2024, the registry serves as a critical tool in improving survival rates, ensuring continuity of care, and enhancing the quality of life for children and adolescents with T1DM in the State

title: India, Brunei hold inaugural defence JWG meet
content: Key areas of discussion include the expansion of military-to-military exchanges, joint training and enhanced maritime security cooperation

title: Leh body seeks public input on fresh draft proposal for MHA on issues faced by Ladakh

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi questions EC, slams RSS, warns of threat to democracy in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi delivered a blistering speech in the Lok Sabha during the election reforms debate, accusing the government and the Election Commission of institutional capture, raising concerns over â€œvote chori,â€ and questioning changes to key electoral laws. He also criticised the RSS, celebrated Indiaâ€™s democratic spirit, and proposed urgent reforms to protect free and fair elections.

title: IndiGo flight cuts to spike airfares in peak season, leave passengers with few options
content: Back-of-the-envelope calculations indicate that reducing daily flights from 400 to 500 will affect 65,000 to 81,000 daily passengers, who had probably booked their seats weeks in advance
